author.name: sanjeev
author.title: My Little Van Gogh
author.description: Last Friday, I got a text message from a school in Gurgaon to collect an appreciation gift for my younger son who won the first prize in a colouring contest that they held at their school and where several schools from Gurgaon participated. First prize??? That can’t be true, at least genetically, I thought. I never got a first prize in my life in anything. But I had seen Rajit scribbling on and ruining the walls of our drawing room a few times and knew that he had it in him :-). - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Last Friday, I got a text message from a school in Gurgaon to collect an appreciation gift for my younger son who won the first prize in a colouring contest that they held at their school and where several schools from Gurgaon participated. First prize??? That can’t be true, at least genetically, I thought. I never got a first prize in my life in anything. But I had seen Rajit scribbling on and ruining the walls of our drawing room a few times and knew that he had it in him :-).

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Linked data based integration
author.description: Recently I was involved in a study to evaluate how the semantic web space is evolving and how can we leverage these new technology trends to power our integration architecture. Linked data was one of the many building blocks of semantic web and I found it really interesting technology that I believe has a potential to be used as a key integration technology in future. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Recently I was involved in a study to evaluate how the semantic web space is evolving and how can we leverage these new technology trends to power our integration architecture. Linked data was one of the many building blocks of semantic web and I found it really interesting technology that I believe has a potential to be used as a key integration technology in future.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Things our kids will probably never relate to
author.description: Today morning while Ranit and I were on our way to Ranit's bus stop, he was telling about how disgusting it was to see cowdung lying around in a farm house that he visited with his classmates sometime back during a school trip. He couldn't make sense of people making cow dung cakes with bare hands. That made me realize how the time has changed and how much fun it used to be for me when I was his age doing the same things that he finds disgusting. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Today morning while Ranit and I were on our way to Ranit's bus stop, he was telling about how disgusting it was to see cowdung lying around in a farm house that he visited with his classmates sometime back during a school trip. He couldn't make sense of people making cow dung cakes with bare hands. That made me realize how the time has changed and how much fun it used to be for me when I was his age doing the same things that he finds disgusting.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Choosing the right collection
author.description: Here is a quick guide for selecting the proper implementation of a Set, List, or Map in your application. The best general purpose or 'primary' implementations are likely ArrayList, LinkedHashMap, and LinkedHashSet. Their overall performance is better, and you should use them unless you need a special feature provided by another implementation ... - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>

The best general purpose or 'primary' implementations are likely ArrayList, LinkedHashMap, and LinkedHashSet. Their overall performance is better, and you should use them unless you need a special feature provided by another implementation ...

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Change default author name for JavaDocs in Eclipse
author.description: The auto generated Java docs at the class level picks the user name from the system user. This could result in weird author names in your code files as in an organization usernames are usually as per organizational naming conventions - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: The auto generated Java docs at the class level picks the user name from the system user. This could result in weird author names in your code files as in an organization usernames are usually as per organizational naming conventions

author.title: Skip over certain classes when using Step Into(F5) in Eclipse’s debugger

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Using Eclipse effectively
author.description: To ensure that the code that you write is always clean and complaint to your project specific coding standards and guidelines, it is important that you configure your eclipse to effectively use its compiler settings, Formatter, CheckStyle and related built in features. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: To ensure that the code that you write is always clean and complaint to your project specific coding standards and guidelines, it is important that you configure your eclipse to effectively use its compiler settings, Formatter, CheckStyle and related built in features.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Troubleshooting eclipse issues
author.description: Following are some tips that shall help you in avoiding potential issues and for being a little more productive while working with eclipse. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Following are some tips that shall help you in avoiding potential issues and for being a little more productive while working with eclipse.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Best practices for threadsafe Singletons
author.description: A singleton class should be designed to ensures that there exists only one instance per application. Special care must be taken if your application is deployed on a clustered environment as in this case it is possible that multiple instance of your singleton class are available in your application. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: A singleton class should be designed to ensures that there exists only one instance per application. Special care must be taken if your application is deployed on a clustered environment as in this case it is possible that multiple instance of your singleton class are available in your application.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Overloading can be tricky
author.description: Extra care must be taken while writing Overloading methods. The compiler decides which version of an overloaded method will be called based on declared compile-time type, not run-time type. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Extra care must be taken while writing Overloading methods. The compiler decides which version of an overloaded method will be called based on declared compile-time type, not run-time type.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Prefer using parameterized types over raw types
author.description: When generics were introduced in JDK 1.5, raw types were retained only to maintain backwards compatibility with older versions of Java. Although using raw types is still possible, they should be avoided for following reasons.. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: When generics were introduced in JDK 1.5, raw types were retained only to maintain backwards compatibility with older versions of Java. Although using raw types is still possible, they should be avoided for following reasons..

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Prefer switch over if-else
author.description: In most cases switch will be lighter and performs faster than an if/else ladder. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: In most cases switch will be lighter and performs faster than an if/else ladder.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Avoiding null pointer exceptions
author.description: Null pointer exceptions(NPE) are the undoubtedly the most common and most annoying errors. In most cases I have observed that it could have been avoided by simply sticking to some best coding practices while writing code. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Null pointer exceptions(NPE) are the undoubtedly the most common and most annoying errors. In most cases I have observed that it could have been avoided by simply sticking to some best coding practices while writing code.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Crave for immutable classes
author.description: Classes should be immutable unless there's a very good reason to make them mutable....If a class cannot be made immutable, limit its mutability as much as possible - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Classes should be immutable unless there's a very good reason to make them mutable....If a class cannot be made immutable, limit its mutability as much as possible

author.title: Ajax primer

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Beware of floating point numbers

author.content: iOutside of a scientific or engineering context, the use of float and double (and the corresponding wrapper classes Float and Double ) should likely be avoided.

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Overridable methods need special care
author.description: Allowing a method to be overridden should always be done intentionally, not by accident. Any method which is not private, static, or final can be overridden. - <a href="">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Allowing a method to be overridden should always be done intentionally, not by accident. Any method which is not private, static, or final can be overridden.
